map --hook

chainloader (hdY)+1

boot

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Not enough data.

Cannot compute.

However, this:

> 6. Setup starts with an error: can't find WVBlk32.Sys, WinVBlk.Inf, WinVBlk.Cat

evidently means that for whatever reasons the Winvblock driver is NOT found even during Text Mode setup.

Try booting from the USB device at the grub4dos menu press c to get to command line.

Type in it:

```

map --mem /w
```

press \[TAB\]

add letters if needed and let it autocomplete untill you get to:

```

map --mem /winvblock.ima
```

type

```

(fd0)
```

so that the full line will look like:

```

map --mem /winvblock.ima (fd0)
```

press \[ENTER\]

Type:

```

map --hook
```

\[ENTER\]

```

root (fd0)
```

\[ENTER\]

```

ls
```

\[ENTER\]

What do you see?

Alternatively to the Wimb's tool (that BTW has worked and is working in thousands of cases or however does not normally create the issue you are reporting), you could use this other approach, making use of a Virtual Machine for the install:

[http://www.linuxbyex...n-usb-disk.html](http://www.linuxbyexamples.net/2012/08/How-to-install-and-run-a-full-winxp-on-usb-disk.html "External link")

(try making the .vhd as small as possible)
